segments.text: What am I doing ? What am I doing ? Don ’ t you know what day it is ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: It ’ s only the day when the world ’ s biggest sporting event is kicking off .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: The World Cup ! The first match is today ! It ’ s Mexico vs . South Africa ! It ’ s going to be a really good match ! Both teams have a very strong offense and have skilled players . I think that South Africa will probably dominate the first half since they are the host country , and all .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I have no idea what you ’ re talking about . The only sporting event we watch at home is the Super Bowl .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: This is bigger than the Super Bowl , man ! Teams from 32 countries compete against each other every four years and fight to win that trophy . They first start in a group stage with bigger groups , each group having 4 teams . The top 2 teams pass on to an elimination stage before going on to the quarter final sand semifinals .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Sounds interesting , but soccer doesn ’ t really appeal to me .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Are you kidding ? Over seven hundred million people watched the final match of the World Cup ! It ’ s a very exciting and nerve wracking sport ! Each nation is cheering on their team , hoping they will become the next champion . So far Brazil is the team with the most titles under their belt ; they ’ re really good !
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: All I know about soccer is that you can ’ t use your hands and that players are always falling down , trying to get a free kick or penalty kick . It seems like a sissy sport to me !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Whatever dude , I ’ m going to go watch the opening match .
segments.speaker: S2
